newsitem.title: DENMARK: Rate cuts sign of new European growth - Lykketoft.
newsitem.headline: Rate cuts sign of new European growth - Lykketoft.

text.p: Denmark's Finance Minister Mogens Lykketoft said on Friday that the latest wave of European interest rate cuts was a sign of renewed growth, vital for export-dependent Denmark.
"This can only strengthen the impression that things are going the right way," Lykketoft told Reuters.
"It is vital for Denmark that the nascent upturn in Europe and specially in Germany is growing stronger. It is of key importance for Denmark that the German trend improves," he said.
Denmark's central bank on Friday cut its 14-day certificate of deposit (CD) rate to 3.50 point from 3.70 percent.
The move followed rate cuts by Germany, France, Austria, Belgium and the Netherlands on Thursday.
